address.street: Unit 3, Edgefield Industrial Estate Edgefield Road
Alistair Hindle Associates Ltd. 66 Hanover Street

description.p: This invention relates to a hydraulic or pneumatic motor or pump (a "fluid-working machine").

EP-B-0494236 introduces a mechanism for actuating electromagnetic poppet valves in a fluid-working machine, using the pre-compression and pre-expansion of the contents of a working chamber to create a motoring cycle of the machine. Working chambers of the machine are selected in real time so that fluid power is controllably converted to shaft power and vice versa, thus allowing a controllable bi-directional energy flow. The nature of poppet valves is that the fluid pressure acts over the seating area creating a large closing force. The motoring cycle of EP-B-0494236 relies on the energy from an already spinning shaft to allow the opening of the solenoid-operated poppet valve against the pressure in the high-pressure manifold. This requirement limits the use of this technique to conditions where the machine is already operating above a threshold shaft speed. For applications with the requirement of starting from zero speed, the motoring cycle must be initiated by different means.

US-A-5735582 describes an electromagnetic valve assembly comprising a master valve and an auxiliary valve, the auxiliary valve serving to open the master valve against a high pressure. In order for the master valve to open, fluid must flow along a capillary between the master valve body and the bore until the pressure is equalised. This means that actuation of the valve assembly requires 200 to 300 ms which is too slow for use in a fluid- working machine.

EP 1,327,810 (Danfoss) discloses a valve arrangement comprising a main valve and an electromagnetically actuated auxiliary valve for use in a vacuum line. GB 672,696 (United Aircraft Products Inc.) describes a valve in a fluid line between a high and low pressure. The valve has an internal chamber and is operated by varying the fluid pressure in the internal chamber. Accordingly, as with the valve of US-A-5735582, both documents disclose valves requiring leakage of fluid to equalise a pressure differential and are thus also not adapted for rapid actuation.

It is an aim to provide a face-seating valve, interposed between the working chamber and the high-pressure manifold of a fluid-working machine, which can open whilst the latter is pressurised and the output shaft of the machine is stationary.

Accordingly, the present invention provides a method of carrying out motoring cycles in a fluid-working machine according to claim 1. Optional features of the invention are set out in the dependent claims.

The valve arrangement is capable of functioning because the working chamber is essentially a contained volume and the leakage flow is limited to the sum of the volume change due to compression and fluid leakage from the working chamber.

In operation of the machine once the pressure between the high-pressure line and the working chamber has equalised it is possible, with a force of modest magnitude, to move the main valve element into the open position in order to complete the second stage of operation.

It is also possible, and advantageous, for a machine of this type with the integral main and auxiliary valves to function in the same way as in EP-B-0494236. The valve begins with two-stage operation at start-up, continues to use it during low-speed operation and automatically changes to single-stage operation with the pre-compression cycle as speed increases.
The invention will now be described in more detail, by way of example only, with reference to the accompanying drawings, in which:
Figure 1 is a schematic diagram showing the general principle of the invention;
Figure 2 is a schematic sectional view of a valve arrangement in a closed position;
Figure 3 shows the valve arrangement of Figure 2 in the first stage of operation;
Figure 4 shows the valve arrangement of Figure 2 in the second stage of operation; and
Figure 5 is a schematic sectional view of a valve arrangement.

Figure 1 shows how a fluid-working machine operating in a motoring cycle. A solenoid-operated, normally-open, face-seating low-pressure line valve 1 is interposed between the line 7 and a working chamber 2 of cyclically varying volume. A solenoid-operated, normally-closed, face-seating high-pressure line valve 4, interposed between the working chamber and the high-pressure line 6, is connected in parallel with a much smaller pressure-equalising valve 5. The low-pressure line valve 1 has its poppet facing the working chamber 2, while the high-pressure line valve 4 has its poppet facing the high-pressure manifold.
The following is a description of the complete motoring cycle utilising the two-stage high-pressure valve operation.

At the beginning of the motoring cycle the low-pressure line valve 1 is in the open position, and the high-pressure line valve 4 and the pressure equalising valve 5 are in the closed position. The pressure in the high-pressure line 6 is above the pressure of the low-pressure line 7. The pressure in the working chamber 2 equals the pressure of the low-pressure line 7.

The motoring cycle starts with the closing of low-pressure line valve 1 and the piston moving, possibly from rest, towards bottom-dead centre. Next the pressure-equalising valve 5 is commanded to open. With the valves 1, 5 in these positions, the pressure in the high-pressure line 6 and the working chamber 2 will equalise. Once the pressure has equalised, high-pressure line valve 4 can be commanded to open. The working chamber 2 is now connected to the high-pressure line 6 and disconnected from the low-pressure line 7 so that the high-pressure fluid can act on the piston 3 and produce torque on the crankshaft of the machine, through the downstroke. The pressure-equalising valve 5 can be closed as soon as high-pressure line valve 4 has opened or might be left open for the duration of the motoring stroke. Both valve 4 and valve 5 have to be closed before the piston 3 reaches bottom-dead-centre. The remaining expansion of the working space, as the piston 3 reaches its limit condition, will depressurise it and allow low-pressure line valve 1 to open. With this valve in the open position and valves 4 and 5 in the closed position it is now possible to displace the fluid into the low-pressure line 7 as the piston 3 moves toward its top-dead-centre position.

Figure 2 shows the pressure equalising valve in the form of a sliding spool valve integrated into the main poppet valve. A fluid chamber 8 is connected to the high-pressure line. A passage 9 is connected to the working chamber. A ferromagnetic moving pole ring 10 can slide along the base of a poppet 11. A pole compression spring 12 forces the moving pole towards the head of the poppet 11. The poppet 11 has a flow channel 13 connecting the fluid chamber 8 and the working chamber passage 9. The moving pole 10 covers the entry to the flow channel when the moving pole 10 is close to head of the poppet 11 and opens the flow channel 13 when it has moved away from the head of the poppet, as shown in Figure 3. The poppet 11 can slide along a guide 14. A poppet compression spring 15 is employed to force the poppet toward its seat 16. The preload on spring 15 is lower than the preload on pole compression spring 12. A solenoid coil 17 is arranged to create magnetic flux to attract the moving pole 10 towards a static pole 18.

The pole ring 10 is displaced axially when the coil 17 is energised. This pole ring acts directly on pole spring 12 and, if there is significant pressure gradient between the high-pressure chamber 8 and the passage 9 so that the poppet 11 is held against the seat 16, then the pole ring will slide on the poppet shank and expose the holes 13, as shown in Figure 3. This connects the two spaces and equalises the pressure across the valve arrangement. Once the pressure is equalised, so long as the force of poppet spring 15 is less than that of pole spring 12 across the full range of displacement, the axial force of pole spring 12 on the poppet shank will pull the poppet 11 away from the seat 16 and open the main fluid passageway, as shown in Figure 4.

During high cycling rates of the working chamber there will not be sufficient time for this two-stage operation to take place. In this case the solenoid coil of the low-pressure normally-open valve 1 will be energised just before the working chamber reaches its minimum volume condition so that the pressure in the working chamber rises in the closed volume and equals that of the high-pressure manifold and so that, when the coil of the normally-closed valve is energised, the moving pole ring 10 moves in unison with the poppet 11 and opens the valve in a single stage.
Figure 5 shows an alternative pressure equalising valve 5 in the form of an auxiliary poppet type valve 19 integrated into the main solenoid operated poppet valve 11'.

The basic operation is the same as described above. The main difference is the use of auxiliary pressure-equalising poppet valve 19 rather than a sliding of the moving pole 10 to uncover the flow channel 13'.

Again the higher pressure in fluid chamber 8 than that in passage 9 at the beginning of the motoring cycle prevents the poppet 11' from moving towards the static pole 18. The moving pole 10' starts to compress pole spring 12' and poppet spring 15 as it slides away from the head of the poppet 11', removing the auxiliary poppet valve 19 from its seat 20 and opening the flow channel 13'. When the pressure is equalised, main poppet 11' can open under the force of pole spring 12' which is grater than that of poppet spring 15. As before, the main and auxiliary valves move together "automatically" when the motor has sufficient momentum.

claim.claim-text: Verfahren zur Durchführung von Motorbetriebszyklen in einer Flüssigkeitsarbeitsmaschine, wobei die Flüssigkeitsarbeitsmaschine eine Hochdruckleitung (8), eine Arbeitskammer (2) mit einem zyklisch variierenden Volumen, einen Kolben und eine Ventilanordnung umfasst, die zwischen der Hockdruckleitung (6) und der Arbeitskammer (2) mit einem zyklisch variierenden Volumen angeordnet ist und den Flüssigkeitsstrom von der Hockdruckleitung (8) in die Arbeitskammer mit einem zyklisch variierenden Volumen steuert, wobei die Ventilanordnung ein Hockdruckleitungs-Ventil mit einem Ventilelement (11) umfasst, das angeordnet ist, um einen abdichtenden Kontakt mit einer Ventilaufnahme (16) bereitzustellen, und ein Hilfsventil, wobei das Hilfsventil ein elektromagnetisch bewegliches Ventilelement (10) umfasst, um den Druck auf jeder Seite des Hochdruckleitungs-Ventils durch die Anbringungen der Arbeitskammer in direktem Flüssigkeitskontakt mit einem Raum, der das Ventilelement umgibt, auszugleichen, wobei das Verfahren gekennzeichnet ist durch die Öffnung des Hilfsventils, um den Druck auf beiden Seiten des Hochdruckleitungs-Ventils durch die Anordnung der Arbeitskammer mit einem zyklisch variierenden Volumen in direkter Kommunikation mit dem Raum, der das Ventilelement umgibt, auszugleichen, und wobei das Hockdruckleitungs-Ventil und das Hilfsventil geschlossen werden, bevor der Kolben den unteren Totpunkt erreicht.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 1, wobei das Hockdruckleitungs-Ventil und das Hilfsventil integriert sind, wobei das Ventilelement einen inneren Kanal umfasst, der mit einer Öffnung kommuniziert, die durch die Ventilaufnahme definiert ist, und das elektromagnetisch bewegliche Ventilelement ausgelegt ist, um den inneren Kanal in eine direkte Flüssigkeitsverbindung mit dem Raum zu bringen, der das Ventilelement umgibt.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 2, wobei das elektromagnetisch bewegliche Element ein Spulenventilelement umfasst.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 2, wobei das elektromagnetisch bewegliche Element ein Tellerventilelement umfasst, das sich mindestens teilweise im inneren Kanal befindet.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 2, 3 oder 4, wobei Haupt-Vorspannmittel (15) bereitgestellt sind, um das Ventilelement auf die Ventilaufnahme hin zu spannen, und das Hilfs-Vorspannmittel (12, 12') bereitgestellt ist, um das Hilfselement in eine Position zu spannen, in der der innere Kanal vom umgebenden Raum isoliert ist.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 5, wobei die Haupt- und/oder Hilfs-Vorspannmittel Schraubenfedern umfassen.
Verfahren nach Anspruch 5 oder 6, wobei das Hilfs-Vorspannmittel (12, 12') eine größere Kraft als das Haupt-Vorspannmittel (15) ausübt.
Verfahren nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei das Hilfsventil in das Hochdruckleitungs-Ventil integriert ist.

Verfahren nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, wobei das Ventilelement (11) ein Tellerventil mit einem Tellerschaft ist, wobei ein beweglicher Polring (10) gleitbar auf dem Tellerschaft montiert ist und eine Poldruckfeder (12), die auf den Polring (10) und den Tellerschaft wirkt.

Verfahren nach einem der vorhergehenden Ansprüche, gekennzeichnet durch die Anweisung des elektromagnetisch beweglichen Ventilelements (10), sich zu öffnen, wodurch die Hochruckleitung in eine direkte Flüssigkeitskommunikation mit der Arbeitskammer mit einem zyklisch variierenden Volumen gebracht wird.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 10, wobei die Anbringung der Hockdruckleitung in einer direkten Flüssigkeitskommunikation mit der Arbeitskammer mit dem zyklisch variierenden Volumen ermöglicht, dass Flüssigkeit von der Hockdruckleitung in die Arbeitskammer mit dem zyklisch variierenden Volumen fließt, um dadurch den Druck zwischen der Hochdruckleitung und der Arbeitskammer mit dem zyklisch variierenden Volumen auszugleichen, und das Ventilelement (11) von der Ventilaufnahme (16) weg gezogen wird, nach dem sich der Druck auf der gesamten Ventilanordnung ausgeglichen hat.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 10 oder Anspruch 11, wobei sich bei hohen Zyklusraten der Arbeitskammer mit dem zyklisch variierenden Volumen das elektromagnetisch bewegliche Ventilelement (10) und das Ventilelement (11) im Einklang bewegen.

Verfahren nach Anspruch 12, wobei die Flüssigkeitsarbeitsmaschine weiter eine NiederdruckventilAnordnung (1) umfasst, die zwischen der Niederdruckleitung (7) und der Arbeitskammer mit einem zyklisch variierenden Volumen (2) angeordnet ist, um den Flüssigkeitsstrom von der Arbeitskammer (2 ) in die Niederdruckleitung (7) zu steuern, und wobei vor der Bewegung des elektromagnetisch beweglichen Ventilelements (10) und des Ventilelements (11) in Einklang die Niederdruckventilanordnung (1) direkt bevor die Arbeitskammer mit dem zyklisch variierenden Volumen ihre minimalen Volumenbedingung erreicht, geschlossen wird, um dadurch den Druck zwischen der Hockdruckleitung und der Arbeitskammer mit dem zyklisch variierenden Volumen auszugleichen.

A method of carrying out motoring cycles in a fluid working machine, the fluid working machine comprising a high-pressure line (8), a working chamber (2) of cyclically varying volume, a piston, and a valve arrangement disposed between the high pressure line (6) and the working chamber (2) of cyclically varying volume and controlling fluid flow from the high-pressure line (8) to the working chamber of cyclically varying volume, the valve arrangement comprising a high pressure line valve having a valve element (11) arranged to provide sealing contact with a valve seat (16), and an auxiliary valve, the auxiliary valve comprising an electromagnetically-movable valve member (10) for equalising pressure on either side of the high pressure line valve by placing a said working chamber in direct fluid communication with a space surrounding said valve element, the method characterised by opening the auxiliary valve to equalise pressure on either side of the said high pressure line valve by placing the said working chamber of cyclically varying volume into direct communication with the space surrounding said valve element, and wherein the high pressure line valve and the auxiliary valve are closed before the piston reaches bottom dead centre.

A method according to claim 1, wherein the high pressure line valve and the auxiliary valve are integrated, the valve element having an internal conduit communicating with an opening defined by the valve seat, and the electromagnetically-movable valve member being adapted to place the internal conduit in direct fluid communication with said space surrounding said valve element.
A method according to claim 2, wherein the electromagnetically- movable member comprises a spool valve member.
A method according to claim 2, wherein the electromagnetically- movable member comprises a poppet valve member located at least partly within the internal conduit.

A method according to claim 2, 3 or 4, wherein main biasing means (15) are provided for biasing the valve element towards the valve seat, and auxiliary biasing means (12, 12') are provided for biasing the auxiliary member to a position in which the internal conduit is isolated from the surrounding space.
A method according to claim 5, wherein the main and/or auxiliary biasing means comprise helical springs.
A method according to claim 5 or 6, wherein the auxiliary biasing means (12, 12') exerts a greater force than the main biasing means (15).
A method according to any one preceding claim, wherein the auxiliary valve is integrated into the high pressure line valve.

A method according to any one preceding claim, wherein the valve element (11) is a poppet valve having a poppet shank, a moving pole ring (10) slidably mounted on the poppet shank, and a pole compression spring (12) which acts on the pole ring (10) and the poppet shank.

A method according to any one preceding claim, characterised by commanding the electromagnetically-moveable valve member (10) to open, thereby placing the high-pressure line in direct fluid communication with the working chamber of cyclically varying volume.

A method according to claim 10, wherein placing the high-pressure line in direct fluid communication with the working chamber of cyclically varying volume allows fluid to flow from the high-pressure line into the working chamber of cyclically varying volume to thereby equalise the pressure between the high pressure line and the working chamber of cyclically varying volume, and the valve element (11) is pulled away from the valve seat (16) after the pressure across the valve arrangement has equalised.

A method according to claim 10 or claim 11, wherein at high cycling rates of the working chamber of cyclically varying volume the electromagnetically-moveable valve member (10) and the valve element (11) move in unison.

A method according to claim 12, wherein the fluid-working machine further comprises a low pressure valve arrangement (1) disposed between the low-pressure line (7) and the working chamber of cyclically varying volume (2) for controlling fluid flow from the working chamber (2) to the low-pressure line (7), and wherein prior to moving the electromagnetically-moveable valve member (10) and the valve element (11) in unison, the low pressure valve arrangement (1) is closed just before the working chamber of cyclically varying volume reaches its minimum volume condition to thereby equalise the pressure between the high pressure line and the working chamber of cyclically varying volume.

Procédé de réalisation de cycles de motorisation dans une machine fonctionnant avec un fluide, la machine fonctionnant avec un fluide comprenant une ligne haute pression (8), une chambre de travail (2) de volume variant de manière cyclique, un piston et un dispositif de soupape disposé entre la ligne haute pression (6) et la chambre de travail (2) de volume variant de manière cyclique et régulant un écoulement de fluide de la ligne haute pression (8) à la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique, le dispositif de soupape comprenant une soupape de ligne haute pression ayant un élément de soupape (11) agencé pour assurer un contact d'étanchéité avec un siège de soupape (16), et une soupape auxiliaire, la soupape auxiliaire comprenant un élément de soupape électromagnétiquement mobile (10) pour égaliser une pression de chaque côté de la soupape de ligne haute pression par placement de ladite chambre de travail en communication fluidique directe avec un espace entourant ledit élément de soupape, le procédé étant caractérisé par l'ouverture de la soupape auxiliaire pour égaliser la pression de chaque côté de ladite soupape de ligne haute pression par placement de ladite chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique en communication directe avec l'espace entourant ledit élément de soupape, et la soupape de ligne haute pression et la soupape auxiliaire étant fermées avant que le piston n'atteigne un point mort bas.

Procédé selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la soupape de ligne haute pression et la soupape auxiliaire sont intégrées, l'élément de soupape ayant un conduit interne communiquant avec une ouverture définie par le siège de soupape, et l'élément de soupape électromagnétiquement mobile étant apte à placer le conduit interne en communication fluidique directe avec ledit espace entourant ledit élément de soupape.
Procédé selon la revendication 2, dans lequel l'élément électromagnétiquement mobile comprend un élément de distributeur à tiroir.
Procédé selon la revendication 2, dans lequel l'élément électromagnétiquement mobile comprend un élément de soupape champignon situé au moins partiellement à l'intérieur du conduit interne.

Procédé selon l'une des revendications 2, 3 ou 4, dans lequel des moyens de sollicitation principaux (15) sont disposés pour solliciter l'élément de soupape vers le siège de soupape, et des moyens de sollicitation auxiliaires (12, 12') sont disposés pour solliciter l'élément auxiliaire vers une position dans laquelle le conduit interne est isolé de l'espace environnant.
Procédé selon la revendication 5, dans lequel les moyens de sollicitation principaux et/ou auxiliaires comprennent des ressorts hélicoïdaux.
Procédé selon l'une des revendications 5 ou 6, dans lequel les moyens de sollicitation auxiliaires (12, 12') exercent une plus grande force que les moyens de sollicitation principaux (15).
Procédé selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel la soupape auxiliaire est intégrée dans la soupape de ligne haute pression.

Procédé selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel l'élément de soupape (11) est une soupape champignon ayant une tige de champignon, une bague polaire mobile (10) montée coulissante sur la tige de champignon et un ressort de compression polaire (12) qui agit sur la bague polaire (10) et la tige de champignon.

Procédé selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, caractérisé par la commande de l'élément de soupape électromagnétiquement mobile (10) pour qu'il s'ouvre, plaçant ainsi la ligne haute pression en communication fluidique directe avec la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique.

Procédé selon la revendication 10, dans lequel le placement de la ligne haute pression en communication fluidique directe avec la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique autorise du fluide à s'écouler depuis la ligne haute pression dans la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique pour ainsi égaliser la pression entre la ligne haute pression et la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique, et l'élément de soupape (11) est retiré du siège de soupape (16) après que la pression de part et d'autre du dispositif de soupape est égalisée.

Procédé selon l'une des revendications 10 ou 11, dans lequel, à des taux de cycle élevés de la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique, l'élément de soupape électromagnétiquement mobile (10) et l'élément de soupape (11) se déplacent à l'unisson.

Procédé selon la revendication 12, dans lequel la machine fonctionnant avec un fluide comprend en outre un dispositif de soupape basse pression (1) disposé entre la ligne basse pression (7) et la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique (2) pour réguler un écoulement de fluide de la chambre de travail (2) à la ligne basse pression (7), et dans lequel, avant de déplacer l'élément de soupape électromagnétiquement mobile (10) et l'élément de soupape (11) à l'unisson, le dispositif de soupape basse pression (1) est fermé juste avant que la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique n'atteigne son état de volume minimal, pour ainsi égaliser la pression entre la ligne haute pression et la chambre de travail de volume variant de manière cyclique.
